How to use this Video to GIF Converter

  1. Upload your video â€” Select a video file from your device (works with MP4, WebM, MOV, AVI)
  2. Choose quality preset â€” Select Small (for sharing), Balanced (recommended), or High Quality (desktop only)
  3. Convert â€” Click "Convert to GIF" and wait for processing
  4. Download â€” Save your animated GIF to your device

Tips for creating great GIFs

  • Keep it short: 3-10 second clips work best for GIFs
  • Choose interesting moments: Look for clips with clear action or emotion
  • Watch file size: Longer, higher-quality GIFs can be 10+ MB
  • Test on mobile: If sharing online, use Small or Balanced preset
  • Frame rate matters: 10-15 FPS is usually enough for most GIFs

Privacy & Security

Your videos are processed entirely in your web browser using WebAssembly. No files are uploaded to any server. Everything stays on your device, ensuring complete privacy and security.

Frequently Asked Questions

What video formats are supported?

This tool supports MP4, WebM, MOV, and AVI video formats. Most common video files will work.

Why is there a 15-second limit?

GIF files can become very large with longer videos, potentially causing browser slowdowns or crashes, especially on mobile devices.

Why is my GIF file so large?

GIF file size depends on duration, frame rate, resolution, and quality. To reduce size: use shorter clips, lower frame rate (5-10 FPS), smaller dimensions, or the "Small" quality preset.

Will this work on my phone?

Yes! This tool works on mobile browsers. However, for best performance on phones, use shorter clips (under 10 seconds) and the "Small" or "Balanced" preset.
